smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

The function handleUnsignedTransaction has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (IllegalArgumentException("Bad Password")) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: IllegalArgumentException("Bad Password")
Parentheses in (IllegalStateException("NO genesis")) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: IllegalStateException("NO genesis")
Parentheses in (last_run + timing) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: last_run + timing
Parentheses in (inFiat?.toString() ?: "?") are unnecessary and can be replaced with: inFiat?.toString() ?: "?"
Parentheses in (it.has("sessionId") && it.has("sharedKey") && it.has("dappName")) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: it.has("sessionId") && it.has("sharedKey") && it.has("dappName")
Parentheses in (IllegalStateException("Could not create JSON from key")) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: IllegalStateException("Could not create JSON from key")
Parentheses in (progress.currentBlock.toDouble() / progress.highestBlock) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: progress.currentBlock.toDouble() / progress.highestBlock

Parentheses in (!it.transactionState.relayedEtherscan && !it.transactionState.relayedLightClient) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: !it.transactionState.relayedEtherscan && !it.transactionState.relayedLightClient

Parentheses in (signatureData.extractChainID()
                            ?: throw IllegalArgumentException("Cannot extract chainID from RLP")) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: signatureData.extractChainID()
                            ?: throw IllegalArgumentException("Cannot extract chainID from RLP")
Parentheses in (rHEX + sHEX + v?.toHexString()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: rHEX + sHEX + v?.toHexString()
Parentheses in (keyStore.hasKeyForForAddress(currentAddressProvider.getCurrent())) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: keyStore.hasKeyForForAddress(currentAddressProvider.getCurrent())
Parentheses in (IllegalArgumentException("Could not create key")) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: IllegalArgumentException("Could not create key")

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

instances.message: An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.
